column13: Visit (28 7 Days After Last Dose of Study Drug)

column14: Assess the subject's status, any AEs, concomitant medications, treatments, and procedures.
Completed before any other assessments scheduled at relevant visits (Section 11.4.1).
Measured with shoes off. Height will only be collected for subjects 21 years of age on the date of informed consent (Section 11.4.3).

Subjects <18 years of age on the date of informed consent and who completed at least 12 weeks of study drug treatment will have a single ophthalmologic examination at either the ETT or Week 24 Visit, whichever comes first (Section 11.5.6).
Symptom directed physical examinations may be performed at any time if deemed necessary by the investigator (Section 11.5.3).

column13: Visit (28 7 Days After Last Dose of Study Drug)

column14: At telephone contacts, a urine pregnancy test will be performed with a home kit provided by the study site. Results will be reported to the site by telephone.
Performed after subject has been at rest for at least 5 minutes (Section 11.5.5).
Performed after subject has been at rest for at least 5 minutes (Sections 11.5.3 and 11.5.4).
Should be performed pre-bronchodilator and at approximately the same time at each visit (Section 11.4.2).
At each time point, 2 samples will be collected (1 from each arm, Section 11.3).
May occur on Day -1 or Day 1 after eligibility for entry into the Treatment Period has been satisfied.
